00009 #include "TTSymbol.h"
00010 
00011 TTSymbol**      TTSymbol::symbolTable = NULL;
00012 TTUInt32        TTSymbol::symbolTableSize = 0;
00013 
00014 
00015 /****************************************************************************************************/
00016 
00017 TTSymbol::TTSymbol(TTString newString)
00018 {
00019         TTSymbol        *existingSymbol = NULL;
00020         TTUInt32        i;
00021 
00022         for(i=0; i<symbolTableSize; i++){
00023                 if(!strcmp(newString, symbolTable[i]->getString())){
00024                         existingSymbol = symbolTable[i];        // we found it
00025                         break;
00026                 }
00027         }
00028 
00029         string = (char*)malloc(sizeof(char) * (strlen(newString)+1));
00030         strcpy(string, newString);
00031 
00032         if(existingSymbol)
00033                 id = existingSymbol->id;
00034         else{
00035                 id = symbolTableSize;
00036                 
00037                 if(symbolTableSize)
00038                         symbolTable = (TTSymbol**)realloc(symbolTable, sizeof(TTSymbol*) * (symbolTableSize + 1));
00039                 else
00040                         symbolTable = (TTSymbol**)malloc(sizeof(TTSymbol*));
00041                 symbolTableSize++;
00042                 
00043                 symbolTable[symbolTableSize-1] = this;
00044         }
00045 }
00046 
00047 
00048 TTSymbol::~TTSymbol()
00049 {
00050         //should free this to prevent memory leaks, but is it safe to do so?
00051         // maybe we need to reference count...
00052         //free(string);
00053 }
00054 
00055 
00056 // Copy Constructor
00057 TTSymbol::TTSymbol(const TTSymbol& oldSymbol)
00058 {
00059         id = oldSymbol.id;
00060         strcpy(string, oldSymbol.string);
00061 }
00062 
00063 
00064 const TTString TTSymbol::getString()
00065 {
00066         return string;
00067 }
00068 
00069 
00070 const TTUInt32 TTSymbol::getId()
00071 {
00072         return id;
00073 }
00074 
00075 
00076 /****************************************************************************************************/
00077 // Shared (static) Methods
00078 
00079 const TTSymbol* TTSymbol::lookup(const TTString string)
00080 {
00081         TTUInt32        i;
00082 
00083         // NOTE: This lookup is also done up in the constructor
00084         // That allows us to call methods expecting a TTSymbol by
00085         // passing them simple c strings.       
00086         for(i=0; i<symbolTableSize; i++){
00087                 if(!strcmp(string, symbolTable[i]->getString())){
00088                         return symbolTable[i];  // we found it
00089                 }
00090         }
00091         
00092         // If we are here then the symbol wasn't found, so we need to create it
00093         return new TTSymbol(string);
00094 }
